metadata.title: CVE-2019-14493 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in OpenCV before 4.1.1. There is a NULL pointerdereference in the function cv::XMLParser::parse atmodules/core/src/persistence.cpp.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14493` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopencv-calib3d4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-contrib4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-core4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-dnn4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-features2d4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-flann4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-highgui4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-imgcodecs4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-imgproc4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-ml4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-objdetect4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-photo4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-shape4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-stitching4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-superres4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-video4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-videoio4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-videostab4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv-viz4.2 - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv4.2-java - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
libopencv4.2-jni - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
opencv-data - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
python3-opencv - 4.2.0+dfsg-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: opencv package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0+dfsg-5').
